abilitygroupdescription.p: Skullduggery involve abilities associated with larceny, thievery and spycraft.

abilitydescription.p: Reaction to being attacked with a Piercing weapon. The character makes a cloak fighting check to use their cloak to Block the attack. The character should be wearing a cloak, but a character can improvise by using a blanket, curtain, tablecloth if they have to. On a success the attack does no damage, with boon the character can perform an opposed Strength check to disarm the attacker, with bane the character performs an Agility+Rank check vs DC 13 or falls prone. On a failure the character takes damage as normal, with boon they take half damage, with bane they take double damage.

concealment Characters or monsters can conceal themselves from other creatures. Concealment is a relationship between two groups of creatures. For example given three groups; a party of adventurers, a large band of goblins and some goblin scouts; then it may be possible that the adventurers are concealed from the band of goblins, and the goblin scouts are concealed from the adventurers.

Because negotiation is a free action it is usually possible for information about concealed parties to spread amongst allied parties almost instantaneously provided that they can communicate with one another.

If the party remains still then no further concealment checks need be made. If the party would like to move, someone needs to make a sneak check. Attacks from concealment should usually grant surprise.
The character is supple and or double jointed. They have studied the art of escaping from bindings. At higher ranks they may be able to earn money in towns and cities performing shows.

A character can attempt to attack an opponent that is unaware of the attacker using the Roques Strike ability. In order to do so the character makes a back stab attempt against the opponents perception and then a normal attack. If the backstab is succsesful the opponent can only defend using Armour (not Dodge, Parry etc) and a hit will do double the weapons damage. If the Back Stab check is unsuccessful then the attack proceeds as usual. If the opponent is flanked then the flanking bonuses to hit are added irrespective of whether the backstab was successful. The Backstab ability can only be used once per combat per character.

An opponent can be unaware if an attacker for a number of reasons: the attacker is invisible, the attacker has made a successful Conceal, or Sneak check before the combat, or if the opponent is unaware that the attacker is a an enemy of theirs (perhaps the character has infiltrated the opponents group using Deceive or Disguise).

Hiding in urban environments. Shadowing people and remainging undetected. The character rolls against the highest opponents perception and is undetected if they succeed. Can also be used to evade pursuit in urban environments.
